newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL -- Cisco extends descent.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL -- Cisco extends descent.

text.p: Cisco Systems Inc continued to spin out of favor preceding Monday's U.S. market open, the shares selling this time on PaineWebber's downgrade to neutral from buy, traders said.
Preceding the opening bell, Cisco stock fell 3-3/8 to 48 in vigorous third market activity, they said.
Since mid-January, Cisco stock has fallen from 75, along with a general decline in computer networking stocks.
Other networking-related stocks active before the open were 3Com Corp off 13/16 to 33, Tellabs Inc unchanged at 40-9/16, U.S. Robotics down 1-3/8 to 55 and FORE Systems Inc off 1-1/8 to 24-5/8.
Traders said they expected Microchip Technology Inc shares to rebound partially at Monday's market open.
On Friday. the stock fell 6-5/16 to 29-1/4 in a selloff related to a profit-shortfall warning by rival company Atmel Corp, which plummeted 4-3/4 to 26-3/4.
Before Monday's open, Microchip added 1/2 to 29-3/4, while Atmel was untraded, though quoted higher.
Atmel's early quote was 27-1/8 bid, 27 ask.
Elsewhere before the open, Intel Corp surrendered 3/4 to 142-3/4, Microsoft rose 1/4 to 97 and Cascade Communications Corp declined 5/8 to 25-1/2.
CNS Inc fell significantly before the open, dropping to 8-7/8 from 11-1/4.
The company warned late Friday that first quarter earnings will be significantly below the First Call consensus estimate of $0.23 per share.
